docs.snippet: Three books take different approaches to the subject of tennis, but all genuflect to both Roger Federer and David Foster Wallace....
docs.lead_paragraph: Three books take different approaches to the subject of tennis, but all genuflect to both Roger Federer and David Foster Wallace.
docs.abstract: Jay Jennings reviews books Love Game: A History of Tennis, From Victorian Pastime to Global Phenomenon by Elizabeth Wilson, Late to the Ball: Age. Learn. Fight. Love. Play Tennis. Win. by Gerald Marzorati and Federer and Me: A Story of Obsession by William Skidelsky.

docs.snippet: Golden State has drastically extended the standard scoring range, which makes comparing it with storied N.B.A. teams of yore like distinguishing between a smartphone and a land line....
docs.lead_paragraph: Golden State has drastically extended the standard scoring range, which makes comparing it with storied N.B.A. teams of yore like distinguishing between a smartphone and a land line.
docs.abstract: Harvey Araton On Pro Basketball column argues comparing Golden State Warriors, whose success behind three-point line is unprecedented, to other NBA championship dynasties is futile; suggests team's perseverance against adversity is best measure of its greatness.

headline.main: Comparisons? Golden State Warriors Are Playing a Different Game
headline.print_headline: There’s No Point in Comparisons: They Hit 3s at Will
